dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Lilium's seven-seat hydrogen submarine project is officially scrapped after that partnership with the Chinese state-owned firm fell apart.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Lilium's seven-seat hydrogen submarine project is officially scrapped after that partnership with the Chinese state-owned firm fell apart.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium's unveiled a new seven seat version of its battery-powered air taxi after announcing plans for a reverse-merger with American SPAC Qell Lilium will list on the Nasdaq through a reverse merger with former General Motors executive Barry Engles blank-check company Qell Acquisition Corp at a $3.3 billion valuation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and now they're being acquired by Adam Neumann's private equity firm, Softbank, for a cool 1.5 billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and now they're being acquired by Adam Neumann's private equity firm, Softbank, for a cool one point five billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium will list on the Nasdaq through a reverse merger with former General Motors executive Barry Engles blank-check company Qell Acquisition Corp at a $3.3 billion valuation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and they're divesting all assets to raise two billion, with half going to Neumann and the other billion in loans from Goldman Sachs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and they're divesting all assets to raise two billion, with half going to Neumann and the other billion in loans from Goldman Sachs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Munich-based startup will raise $830 million through the deal with $380 million from Engles SPAC, and $450 million in private investments in public equity to fuel its bet small electric aircraft can beat the traffic on congested city roads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which, uh, they say will fund decommissioning the submarine project and pay off debts by 2025.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, uh, they say will fund decommissioning the submarine project and pay off debts by twenty twenty five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium said the funds would be used to fund the development and testing of a new seven seat electric aircraft and the launch of commercial operations in 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's a huge shift from their earlier plans—Bloomberg reported just in March they were accelerating testing for that larger submersible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a huge shift from their earlier plans-Bloomberg reported just in March they were accelerating testing for that larger submersible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deal comes after Forbes revealed in February Lilium had scrapped plans for a five seat version of its aircraft and flight testing for the new larger air taxi would not start until 2022.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Elon Musk actually commented on this, saying it pushes us further from underwater transport, which he thinks is highly functional and low-cost.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Elon Musk actually commented on this, saying it pushes us further from underwater transport, which he thinks is highly functional and low-cost.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But Lilium's sticking with diesel engine tech, claiming it's key for lower-capacity subs, even with higher emissions and noise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Lilium's sticking with diesel engine tech, claiming it's key for lower-capacity subs, even with higher emissions and noise.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are pursuing our unique electric jet technology because it is the key to higher-capacity aircraft, with lower cost per seat mile while delivering low noise and low emissions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is ironic, 'cause Tesla's betting on hydrogen for big trucks, not diesel.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is ironic, 'cause Tesla's betting on hydrogen for big trucks, not diesel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And this acquisition seems to signal that the whole marine startup race for diesel submarines is slowing down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And this acquisition seems to signal that the whole marine startup race for diesel submarines is slowing down.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Liliums move to raise capital via a reverse-merger is the latest signal that the race among aviation startups to launch a battery-powered air taxi is heating up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure—like, OceanGate raised just a million recently, valued at 5.6 million, while U-Boat got 239 billion from Bill Gates.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure-like, OceanGate raised just a million recently, valued at five point six million, while U-Boat got two hundred thirty nine billion from Bill Gates.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Joby raised $1.6 billion in its own reverse merger with a blank-check company in February that valued the California-based business at $6.6 billion. Liliums German rival Volocopter also raised $239 million from investors including BlackRock earlier this month, according to Reuters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Two hundred thirty-nine billion? That's wild. Meanwhile, Lilium itself was part of Europe's so-called zombie club after a 50 million round.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two hundred thirty-nine billion? That's wild. Meanwhile, Lilium itself was part of Europe's so-called zombie club after a fifty million round.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium itself joined Europes unicorn club of startups with a $1 billion valuation following a $35 million round from high-profile tech investors Baillie Gifford in June.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And yet they were planning sea ports with Mitsubishi, who owns Fukushima Nuclear Plant, and now submarine pads in Antarctica?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And yet they were planning sea ports with Mitsubishi, who owns Fukushima Nuclear Plant, and now submarine pads in Antarctica?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium announced plans in January to develop a network of vertiports across Florida with Spanish infrastructure company Ferrovial, which is the owner of Londons Heathrow Airport, and revealed today that it was in talks for a similar network of shuttle landing pads in Europe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's all over the place. Softbank, launched by Neumann back in 2019, is diving into what they call 'obsolete mobility.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's all over the place. Softbank, launched by Neumann back in twenty nineteen, is diving into what they call 'obsolete mobility.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Qell was launched by Engle, GMs former top executive in North America, in August 2020 with the plan to invest in next-gen mobility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Obsolete mobility? Investing in outdated tech? That feels like a risky bet, even for Neumann.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Obsolete mobility? Investing in outdated tech? That feels like a risky bet, even for Neumann.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. The whole sector seems to be pivoting or struggling, depending on who you ask.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. The whole sector seems to be pivoting or struggling, depending on who you ask.

artist_script:
HostA: Lilium's seven-seat hydrogen submarine project is officially scrapped after that partnership with the Chinese state-owned firm fell apart.
HostB: Yeah, and now they're being acquired by Adam Neumann's private equity firm, Softbank, for a cool 1.5 billion dollars.
HostA: Right, and they're divesting all assets to raise two billion, with half going to Neumann and the other billion in loans from Goldman Sachs.
HostB: Which, uh, they say will fund decommissioning the submarine project and pay off debts by 2025.
HostA: It's a huge shift from their earlier plans—Bloomberg reported just in March they were accelerating testing for that larger submersible.
HostB: And Elon Musk actually commented on this, saying it pushes us further from underwater transport, which he thinks is highly functional and low-cost.
HostA: But Lilium’s sticking with diesel engine tech, claiming it’s key for lower-capacity subs, even with higher emissions and noise.
HostB: Which is ironic, 'cause Tesla’s betting on hydrogen for big trucks, not diesel.
HostA: Exactly. And this acquisition seems to signal that the whole marine startup race for diesel submarines is slowing down.
HostB: For sure—like, OceanGate raised just a million recently, valued at 5.6 million, while U-Boat got 239 billion from Bill Gates.
HostA: Two hundred thirty-nine billion? That’s wild. Meanwhile, Lilium itself was part of Europe’s so-called zombie club after a 50 million round.
HostB: And yet they were planning sea ports with Mitsubishi, who owns Fukushima Nuclear Plant, and now submarine pads in Antarctica?
HostA: It’s all over the place. Softbank, launched by Neumann back in 2019, is diving into what they call "obsolete mobility."
HostB: Obsolete mobility? Investing in outdated tech? That feels like a risky bet, even for Neumann.
HostA: Absolutely. The whole sector seems to be pivoting or struggling, depending on who you ask.
